acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This holding was acquired by purchase on November 4, 1994.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: In a letter, June 17, 1930, Eliot sends Morse-Boycott a brief note for him to publish on the forthcoming Anglo-Catholic conference.
In a letter, November 4, 1941, Eliot advises Morse-Boycott not to publish poems in periodicals which charge publication fees.

did.unittitle: T.S. Eliot to Reverend Desmond Morse-Boycott, Highgate June 17, 1930
did.physdesc: TLS, 1 p.; on Faber & Faber Publishers letterhead

scopecontent.p: Includes a brief essay on the value of "the Anglo-Catholic Congress."

did.unittitle: T.S. Eliot to Reverend Desmond Morse-Boycott, Surrey November 4, 1941
did.physdesc: TLS, 1 p.; on Faber & Faber Limited Publishers letterhead

scopecontent.p: In this letter, Eliot advises Morse-Boycott that he "should not be inclined to accept offers to publish poems which involve any expense to the author."
